intro: Chione papyracea, commonly known as the paperflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its delicate, papery petals. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Chione papyracea is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
